title: Biden Politicizes the Social Security Administration
summary: My firing as commissioner violates a 1994 law that aimed to shield the agency from partisanship.. The name of the Social Security Administration's commissioner isn't one most Americans would recognize. This is largely by design. Congress, presidents from both parties, and previous commissioners have made it a point to ensure the commissioner's role remains nonpartisan. That is why President Biden's decision to fire me is so unsettling. I was only two years into my six-year term as SSA commissioner. By targeting me, the administration has politicized the SSA.

title: Resistance and Repression in Cuba
summary: Protesters knew they would meet brutality. They went out anyway, demanding liberty.. During a visit to Moscow in 1991, members of the Cuban-American National Foundation had a quiet meeting with a top KGB official. Diego Suarez, who was at that meeting, told me last week by phone from Miami that, in the KGB man's opinion, Havana's internal-security apparatus was more sophisticated than the Kremlin's.

title: What My Kids Learned From a Videogame
summary: Minecraft started as a Covid diversion and became a class in political science.. My kids survived lockdown by living online, playing Minecraft. They linked up with friends and escaped into this virtual realm, where the goal is to survive and prosper in the wilderness. They re-created "Lord of the Flies," marooning themselves on a distant world free of adult supervision, where they either had to create a new society or, well, kill one another.

title: 'Collision Course' Review: Fall Guy or Crook?
summary: The case of Carlos Ghosn lays bare the differences in corporate, legal and political cultures between Japan and the West.. On Nov. 19, 2018, Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn was taken into custody as he passed through Tokyo's Haneda airport. He was eventually charged with underreporting his income and using millions in Nissan funds to cover personal investment losses, and if convicted he faced up to 15 years in prison. But after spending 130 days in custody, and posting $13.7 million in bail, he fled Japan for Lebanon, hiding in an audio equipment case as it was rolled onto a private jet. He now lives in Beirut, out of reach of Japanese prosecutors.

title: Jordan Harbors Our Daughter's Killer
summary: Biden should demand the extradition of Ahlam Tamimi.. Jerusalem

title: The Inflation Tax on Capital
summary: Biden's capital-gains rate hike is worse than it looks. Under rising prices, it could eat 112% of a return.. June's 5.4% inflation highlights one of President Biden's more damaging and quixotic economic proposals: to raise the top tax rate on capital gains. Nominally, he would pull it up to match the tax rate on ordinary income. But the real rate, taking inflation into account, would be so high that investors could dramatically change their behavior, badly harming the economy and job market.

title: Iran's Answer to Biden's Diplomacy
summary: More attacks on U.S. troops in Iraq and a kidnap plan in New York.. Nuclear talks between the U.S. and Iran adjourned last month and could resume after Iranian President-elect Ebrahim Raisi takes office in August. But Iran's behavior during the interregnum shows what it thinks about President Biden's arms-control overtures.

title: An Immigration Reboot for Biden
summary: A continuing migrant surge and a DACA ruling show the need for a Democratic Party rethink.. The Biden Administration's immigration policy has been a debacle from the start, but two events Friday ought to spur a reboot. Democrats will need one if they want to avoid a political backlash in 2022 and beyond.

title: Tearing Down Cuba's Cyberwall
summary: Technology exists to restore the internet if Biden is willing to use it.. Despots have often sought to crush democratic uprisings by shutting down the internet. Cuba's Communist government did so last week, but President Biden can leverage U.S. technology to tear down Cuba's cyberwall.

title: Infrastructure Bill Drops IRS Funding, Raising Revenue Pressure
summary: Lawmakers, White House move to finish $1 trillion plan by midweek. Lawmakers dropped plans to pay for a roughly $1 trillion infrastructure package in part by boosting tax-collecting enforcement at the Internal Revenue Service, a setback for the bipartisan measure ahead of a looming deadline for agreement.

title: OPEC, Allies Agree to Boost Oil Output as Demand Roars Back
summary: Producers to increase production by 400,000 barrels a day, moving to restore capacity they cut at the start of the Covid-19 pandemic. OPEC and its Russia-led oil-producing allies agreed to unleash millions of barrels of bottled-up crude over the next two years, committing to restore all the cuts they made at the start of the Covid-19 pandemic as many economies pick up and crude demand recovers.

title: Killing of Haiti's President Risks New Wave of Gang Violence
summary: Resume Subscription. PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti-In the days after Haiti's president was shot to death, Jimmy Cherizier, leader of a powerful alliance of gangs here that calls itself the G9, issued an exhortation on YouTube, calling on his followers to rise up against the country's oligarchs and seek justice for the assassinated leader.

title: More Athletes Test Positive for Covid-19 in Japan
summary: The challenge of staging the world's biggest sporting event during a pandemic is becoming clear as a stream of athletes and others test positive for the virus after entering Japan. The long-feared possibility that the Covid-19 pandemic could disrupt the Tokyo Olympics is rapidly emerging as a reality, as Games organizers scramble to deal with a rising load of athletes and officials who are testing positive upon arrival in Japan.

title: Heat Waves, Wildfires Intensify in the West
summary: Stifling temperatures hit Northern Rockies and parts of Idaho, Montana, Utah and Wyoming; heat is expected to last into the workweek. Intense heat engulfed the Northern Rockies and High Plains, while high temperatures and dry air made matters worse for firefighters working to control dozens of wildfires burning across the parched West.

title: Pogacar Wins Second Straight Tour de France as Cavendish Misses Merckx's Record
summary: Without the drama of last year's Tour, the 22-year-old Slovenian took the yellow jersey after Stage 8 and kept it all the way to Paris.. PARIS-When Tadej Pogacar stunned pro cycling to win last year's Tour de France as a 21-year-old rookie, he wore the leader's yellow jersey for all of one stage-the last one. This year, the peloton's dominant stage racer had more time to savor it.

title: Ingersoll Rand Has Made Takeover Bids for SPX Flow
summary: The component maker has so far rebuffed Ingersoll's overtures, which included an all-cash offer that valued SPX in the low-$80s a share. Ingersoll Rand Inc. has made takeover bids for component maker SPX Flow Inc. that have so far been rebuffed, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Economy Week Ahead: Housing, Jobless Claims, ECB
summary: Starts seen rising in June as housing market, along with sales of existing homes. The U.S. housing market is in focus during a relatively light week for economic data.

title: CDC's Covid-19 Cruise Guidelines to Stay in Place for Now
summary: U.S. appeals court temporarily blocks lower-court ruling that overturned a conditional-sailing order. Covid-19 restrictions on Florida-based cruise ships will remain in place, after a federal appeals court temporarily blocked a lower-court ruling that would have lifted the regulations.

title: Germany's Flooding Rearranges Political Picture Ahead of Election to Succeed Merkel
summary: Ignored flood warnings could damage government parties as Greens flash environmental credentials. BERLIN-Last week's devastating floods in Germany that have so far claimed nearly 160 lives have become the central issue of the country's coming election that could reshape its political landscape.

title: Biden's Attack on Facebook Followed Months of Frustration
summary: Rhetoric intensifies as both sides trade accusations of distortions. President Biden's attack on Facebook Inc. on Friday followed months of mounting private frustration inside his administration over the social-media giant's handling of vaccine misinformation, according to U.S. officials, bringing into public view tensions that could complicate efforts to stop the spread of Covid-19.

title: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin Targets Bigger Space Goals
summary: Launch Tuesday is a small step as it tries to make a giant leap in winning government contracts and competing with Elon Musk's SpaceX. Jeff Bezos' plans for space go far beyond the short trip he is slated to take there Tuesday.

title: How to Be an Anticapitalist
summary: Progressive policy makers won't learn that parasites should never kill their host.. It is hard to sit by and watch your economy being strangled. Ibram X. Kendi's book "How to Be an Antiracist" is all the rage now, but the Biden administration and its progressive hangers-on are providing a master class on "How to Be an Anticapitalist" and suck the air out of the economy.

title: Collin Morikawa Wins the British Open
summary: The 24-year-old American won his second major championship and became the first golfer ever to win two different majors in his first attempt. Collin Morikawa arrived in Sandwich, England having never played in a British Open. The lumpy, bumpy terrain he found at Royal St. Georges typfies how this event can torture even those golfers who have played these types of courses for decades.

title: Biden's Self-Refuting Progressivism
summary: If the president thinks pre-pandemic voting laws are racist, why didn't he object to them before now?. 'We're facing the most significant test of our democracy since the Civil War," President Biden said last week. "That's not hyperbole." He was speaking of proposals in the Texas Legislature to roll back some pandemic-related changes to voting procedures, especially 24-hour and drive-through voting. Mr. Biden and his allies on the left have claimed that similar proposals in Georgia and Florida would revive Jim Crow.

title: Peppa Pig, a Pandemic Favorite, Has American Children Acting British
summary: Resume Subscription. California kindergartner Dani stunned her parents in May when she addressed her mom, who said she was going to the eye doctor, in a polished British accent: "Mummy, are you going to the optician?"

title: U.K.'s Boris Johnson Will Self-Isolate for 10 Days
summary: The prime minister met with the health secretary, who tested positive for Covid-19; Treasury chief will also work from home for 10 days. LONDON-Boris Johnson's office said the U.K. prime minister will remain in isolation for the next 10 days after his health minister tested positive for the coronavirus, just hours before a plan to drop almost all Covid-19 restrictions in England comes into effect.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro Released From Hospital After Treatment for Intestinal Blockage
summary: The president, who is expected to run for re-election next year, has had abdominal problems since being stabbed in 2018. SÃO PAULO-Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was released from the hospital Sunday, four days after being hospitalized for an intestinal obstruction, his doctors said.

title: Rocket Rides and Skyscrapers Allow the Rich to Keep Rising
summary: Space tourism follows a long tradition of the wealthy seeking higher altitudes. Rich people keep trying to one-up each other. Going up and up and up.

title: Mark Warner Plays Key Role in Infrastructure, Antipoverty Plans
summary: Centrist Virginia senator says he 'stretched' on spending at Biden's prodding and now works to keep proposals on track. WASHINGTON-When talks among Democrats about a raft of antipoverty and climate-change measures began, Sen. Mark Warner (D., Va.) assumed that lawmakers would agree to spend less than the $3.5 trillion plan announced this past week.

title: Europe Floods Move South and East as Rains Hit Germany, Austria
summary: German Chancellor Angela Merkel visits the hard-hit village of Schuld and calls for more environmental investment. Flooding moved to southern and eastern parts of Germany and into neighboring Austria on Sunday, as heavy rainfall over Alpine regions swelled rivers and overwhelmed several towns in the valleys.

title: Why the U.S. Navy Is in Dire Straits
summary: Bureaucratic bloat and catastrophic reforms, brought about by decades of weak leadership and gross mismanagement.. After a succession of presidents ignorant of and uninterested in naval affairs, there is an emerging realization around the world that the U.S. no longer possesses naval superiority and could lose a war at sea. This is no surprise. It is the result of bureaucratic bloat and catastrophic reforms, brought about by decades of weak leadership and gross mismanagement.

title: Offshore Jobs to Mexico at Your Own Risk
summary: The U.S. shouldn't subsidize the outward flow of investment.. Your editorial "The Keystone XL Goes to Court" (July 9) cites the recent USMCA legal action by a Canadian company against the U.S. as evidence that the Trump administration's position against the Investor State Dispute Settlement (ISDS) provision of the old Nafta was wrong. I would suggest that this litigation proves exactly the opposite.

title: Abandoning Afghanistan Is Yet Another Biden Mistake
summary: I guess this will teach Afghans not to trust the U.S., a valuable lesson they'll never forget.. Regarding your editorial "Biden Says Kabul Is No Saigon" (July 9): Robert Gates, the respected former secretary of defense under both George W. Bush and Barack Obama, wrote in his memoir that Joe Biden had been wrong on "nearly every major foreign policy and national security issue over the past four decades," including the bin Laden operation. Since the book was published in 2014, make that 47 years and counting.

title: False Kindness to Illegal Immigrants Feeds Cruelty by the Border
summary: The only real solution is to remove the motivation to come here.. In his op-ed "Harris vs. Abbott on the Border" (July 8), Karl Rove does a good job describing America's border problem, even though he doesn't include the horrors illegal aliens face making that journey. These include the proportion of women who are sexually assaulted-some estimates are as high as 1 in 3 or 1 in 5-and the large number of elderly people, women and children who die on the journey.

title: What's Hunter Biden Really Selling? Hint: It Isn't Art
summary: There's a reason his paintings are beautiful in the eyes of certain beholders.. Your editorial "Hunter Biden's Secret Art Sale" (July 10) shows remarkable restraint. First, for not using the term "grifter." Second, for not stating the obvious: Art is not what's really for sale.

title: How China Is Helping to Damp Global Inflation
summary: Economists see China as a conduit rather than a source of inflationary pressure in the post-pandemic era. HONG KONG-As China's factory-gate prices soared this year, investors worried the country would become a new source of inflation for the rest of the world.

title: Wall Street Watchdog Keeps Bitcoin ETFs on Ice
summary: Regulators weigh the potential dangers of widening investors' access to cryptocurrencies. For eight years, asset managers have tried to launch bitcoin exchange-traded funds, but success seems no closer now than it did in 2013.

title: Unvaccinated Americans Behind Rising Covid-19 Hospitalizations
summary: Some hospitals in regions where vaccination rates are lower prepare for surges rivaling pandemic peaks. The vast majority of patients driving up Covid-19 hospitalizations in parts of the U.S. are unvaccinated, according to hospitals, some of which are reactivating surge plans used in the peak of the pandemic.

title: Security-Camera Tips to Keep Your Home Safe While You Are Away
summary: How to protect your account against hackers, fortify your Wi-Fi and place your device in a safe location. I joined the summer travel surge last month. In the whirlwind of it all, I remembered to pack my bags, upload a scan of my vaccine card and download my boarding pass. Before running out the door, however, I didn't think to plug in the security camera overlooking my studio apartment. Face, meet palm.

title: Escalating Materials Prices Turn Construction Bids Into a Gamble
summary: Contractors, manufacturers struggle to bid on jobs as costs of pipes, boards and steel keep rising. Construction companies, manufacturers and other businesses that submit bids to win jobs say that process has turned unpredictable as rising materials costs expose them to potential losses.

title: Stock Market Records Rest More on Faith Than Corporate Profits
summary: Wall Street's expectations for this year's corporate profits are still below where they were a year before the pandemic. Yet the S&P 500 is up 60%.. Look at Wall Street forecasts, and the pandemic increasingly seems like little more than a lost year. Predictions for S&P 500 earnings per share this year are almost back up to where they stood at the start of March 2020, before the reality of Covid-19 put red lines through everyone's outlook.

title: Selling Your Used Car? You Could Turn a Profit
summary: Normally a depreciating asset, some used cars are worth more now than they were new. Chevy Silverado owner Franko Dokaj stopped by his dealership recently expecting to buy new floor mats. Instead, he walked away with a killer deal: The store offered to buy his one-year-old truck for $3,000 more than he originally paid for it last spring.

title: In the New China, Didi's Data Becomes a Problem
summary: Country's largest ride-hailing company collected personal data, traffic and mapping information-and that has put it on the radar of authorities. Bolstered by its wide swath of data on users, mapping and traffic, Didi Global Inc. became the dominant ride-hailing company in China. Now, that data is turning into a liability.

title: Record Stock Rally Ignores Wall Street's Phobia About Optimism
summary: Warnings about overly bullish sentiment have been better left unheeded this year. Have times changed?. The latest victim of the rampaging bull market in stocks is the Wall Street maxim that glowing investor sentiment is a sell signal.

title: Crypto Experts in Demand as Countries Launch Digital Currencies
summary: Rebels against traditional monetary systems find themselves advising governments. Monetary authorities around the world are rushing to design digital currencies, and many are asking: Who knows how to do this?

title: China Steels Itself for Fight to Cool Rising Commodities Prices
summary: Officials plan release of additional state stockpiles and other measures as global demand buoys markets for copper, coal, aluminum and more. HONG KONG-China's multipronged campaign to roll back rising commodity prices is pitting the world's largest buyer of many major resources and its brand of command economic policy against global market forces. Prices show victory remains elusive.

title: Red-Hot U.S. Economy Expected to Cool
summary: Growth likely hit a high point in the second quarter and will slow as the boosts from fiscal stimulus and reopenings fade, economists say. The U.S. economy's 2021 growth surge likely peaked in the spring, but a strong expansion is expected to continue into next year, say economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Schools Turn Stimulus Funds Into Teacher Bonuses
summary: Districts and states pay 'thank you' bonuses to lift morale and retain teachers, but some say it is a bad idea. Dozens of school districts and states are spending big chunks of their historic federal stimulus cash on one-time bonuses to teachers and staff, over the objections of some parents and others who claim such payments violate the intent of the federal funding.

title: Washington Nationals Evacuate Stadium After Shooting Outside Ballpark
summary: Three wounded in the incident, which didn't appear to be related to game against San Diego Padres. WASHINGTON-The Washington Nationals baseball team evacuated their stadium midway through their game Saturday night, after a shooting was reported just outside the ballpark.

title: First Covid-19 Infections Among Athletes in Olympic Village Are Confirmed
summary: The two, who are from the same country and compete in the same sport, have been moved to quarantine. TOKYO-Two athletes staying at the Olympic Village in Tokyo have tested positive for Covid-19, the organizers of the Games said.

title: Dozens Treated After Chemical Leak at Six Flags Water Park
summary: Incident was contained to one attraction; people suffered minor skin irritation, respiratory issues. A chemical leak at a Houston-area water park left dozens suffering from minor skin irritation and respiratory issues Saturday, authorities said.
